availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles B. Tucker (Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Wiley Tucker and Sally Tucker. Married to Amanda E. Wilson Tucker. Father of Eliza A. Tucker, Luvenia V. Tucker, Mary Ann Tucker, Mandevil B. Tucker, and Fannie L. Tucker. Farmer in Breckinridge County in 1850 and 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 2, p. 59. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District 2, p. 96. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Hardinsburg, p. 22. Find A Grave, "Charles B. Tucker (1829-1890)," Memorial #19010339, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=19010339 (accessed June 25, 2017).
